bunpro.writeup: In order to specifically express that one thing happens/begins to happen after another thing, てから will be used. This expression is regularly translated as 'once (A) happens, (B)', or 'after doing (A), (B)'.The difference between てから , and the regular て form followed by another verb, is that てから puts more emphasis on the (A) action 'enabling' the (B) action.Cautionから can come after almost any form of verb. てから is the only form that translates as 'after (A), (B)'. た から , and るから will translate closer to 'because', or 'since'.

examples.japanese: 今夜は勉強をするから、遊ばない。
examples.english: I won't hang out tonight, because I will be studying.

examples.japanese: 牛丼の大盛を食べたから、お腹いっぱい。
examples.english: I am full because I ate a large serving of gyudon. (After having eaten a large serving of gyudon)

examples.japanese: 晩ご飯を食べてから、洗い物をする。
examples.english: After I eat, I will do the dishes.

examples.japanese: 日本語の勉強をしてから、日本に行きます。
examples.english: Once I study Japanese, I will go to Japan.

examples.japanese: 日本に行ってから、日本語の勉強をします。
examples.english: After going to Japan, I will study Japanese.

examples.japanese: この本を読んでから、返す。
examples.english: Once I've read this book, I will return it.

examples.japanese: 暇になってから、ゆっくり旅行に行きたい。
examples.english: After becoming free, I want to take a nice, long trip.

examples.japanese: 雪が降ってから、スキーに行く。
examples.english: Once it snows, I will go skiing.

false_friends.meaning: When, From when, Just when, If
For the first time, Not until, Only after, Only when, Only because

dojg.description: After/since a point in time at which something takes place.

examples.japanese: (ks).雪子は晩ご飯を食べてから映画に行った・行きました。
examples.english: After eating her supper, Yukiko went to a movie.

examples.japanese: (a).私は友達に電話してからうちを出た。
examples.english: I left home after making a call to my friend.

examples.japanese: (b).ジョーンズさんはいつもシャワーを浴びてから寝ます。
examples.english: Mr. Jones always goes to bed after taking a shower.

examples.japanese: (c).私達がこの家を買ってからもう十年になる。
examples.english: It's already been ten years since we bought this house.

examples.japanese: (d).二年前に交通事故を起こしてから、ミラーさんは車に乗らないようにしています。
examples.english: Since he caused a traffic accident two years ago, Mr. Miller has been trying not to drive a car.

dojg.writeup: ## 1. Verbてから Sentence means 'Sentence after doing something' or 'Sentence since ~ did something'. The usage of から2 is an extended use of から1.
dojg.formation:
## 

- Vてから
- 話してから
- After talking
- 食べてから
- After eating
dojg.related: 【Related Expression: あとで; てform of verb】
